conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to trace the paths of the liquids flowing from points A, B, C, and D as they interact with the baffles and eventually flow into containers E, F, or G.
Point A is labeled yellow, and liquid flows down from it encountering the orange baffle.
The orange baffle directs the liquid from A to the left.
The liquid from A continues to flow down and encounters the yellow baffle at the bottom.
The yellow baffle directs the liquid from A towards container E.
The yellow liquid from A flows into container E.
Point B is labeled green, and liquid flows down from it encountering the orange baffle.
The orange baffle directs the liquid from B to the right.
The liquid from B continues to flow down and encounters the light blue baffle at the bottom.
The light blue baffle directs the liquid from B towards container F.
The green liquid from B flows into container F.
Point C is labeled light blue, and liquid flows down from it encountering the gray baffle.
The gray baffle directs the liquid from C to the left.
The liquid from C continues to flow down and encounters the light blue baffle at the bottom.
The light blue baffle directs the liquid from C towards container E.
The light blue liquid from C flows into container E.
Point D is labeled blue, and liquid flows down from it encountering the red baffle.
The red baffle directs the liquid from D to the right.
The liquid from D continues to flow down and encounters the black baffle at the bottom.
The black baffle directs the liquid from D towards container G.
The blue liquid from D flows into container G.
Summary: A (Yellow) -> E, B (Green) -> F, C (Light Blue) -> E, D (Blue) -> G.
Final Answer: Container E receives liquid from A and C. Container F receives liquid from B. Container G receives liquid from D.
